page.title: 02Hemslyn Craft Pottery
page.content: We went to Hemslyn to see how they made pots and Shire horses. First of all we saw some finished Shire horses which were painted and decorated. Then Mr. Middleton took us down to show us the moulds for the Shire horses which were made of plaster of Paris. Then Mr. Middleton showed us the potters wheel. It was not electric. Then he made some pots to demonstrate. After that we asked some questions. We found out that they get their supplies from Kingsteignton. We found out that he makes twelve pots a day, he is not yet in full production. He is very skilled because he used to work in a factory. His daughter and wife make two to four horses a day. All the horses are hand painted.
